definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: The bank is in effect nationalised.
sentences.chinese: 该银行实际上是国有化了。

sentences.english: Nationalizing banks is not without precedent.
sentences.chinese: 银行国有化并非无先例可循。

sentences.english: Some investors have been scared off by nationalisations and arbitrary regulation.
sentences.chinese: 一些投资者被国有化和专横通知吓怕了。

sentences.english: We also need to reverse the nationalization of local police.
sentences.chinese: 我们也应该逆转地方警察机构的国有化趋势。

sentences.english: This produces a far right that likes nationalisation and dislikes the market.
sentences.chinese: 这催生了喜好国有化，厌恶市场的极右翼主义。

sentences.english: And Glitnir, Iceland’s third-largest bank, was nationalised.
sentences.chinese: 冰岛第三大银行Glitnir被国有化。

sentences.english: We want to put equity in, but we don’t want to nationalize the banks.
sentences.chinese: 我们想入股银行，但是并不想将银行国有化。

sentences.english: Here only thing is that they are in a way nationalizing the property of the religious groups.
sentences.chinese: 这里是他们唯一的办法对宗教团体的财产国有化。

sentences.english: It shows what happens when you nationalize banks and credit.
sentences.chinese: 它会告诉你当你国有化银行和信用以后的恶果。

sentences.english: Eventually become in 1976 by the nationalization of Palawan Special oil.
sentences.chinese: 最终在1976年经国有化成为巴拉特石油公司。

sentences.english: Either they should be forced to make it as private companies or they should be nationalized.
sentences.chinese: 要么“双房”被强制真正私有化，要么国有化。

sentences.english: 1946 - The Bank of England is nationalised.
sentences.chinese: 1946年的今天，英格兰银行国有化。

sentences.english: S. banks, which would constitute a partial-nationalization of America's banking sector.
sentences.chinese: 这将造成美国银行部门部分国有化。

sentences.english: The railway has nationalized in our country.
sentences.chinese: 我国的铁路已国有化了。

definition: to nationalize/to take over as communal property
ownership of the means of production (in Marxism)/system of ownership
